name: VIBE CODING
rules:
The Vibe Coding Competition is a fast-paced, creativity-driven programming event designed to test participants’ problem-solving skills, teamwork, and innovation under time constraints.
Round 1 – Coding & Progress Review
Round 2 – Presentation
Problem Statement & Theme
The official problem statement and theme will be revealed on the spot at the beginning of Round 1.
All teams must build their solution only based on the provided theme during the competition time.

name: BATTLE GROUND MOBILE INDIA (BGMI) / FREE FIRE
description: BATTLE GROUND MOBILE INDIA (BGMI) / FREE FIRE
rules:
•Players must use their own accounts; account sharing is prohibited.
•Cheating, hacking, or use of unauthorized third-party software will result in immediate disqualification.
•Players must join the custom room within the given time; late entries will not be entertained.
Organizer Rights:
•Organizers reserve the right to modify rules if necessary. Decisions made by referees/judges are final, Any disputes must be raised immediately after the match.

name: NEXUS 2026 – The Tech Quiz
rules:
•Stage I( Prelims): 20 Qs (Mixed) | No Negative Marking, Qualify: Top 8–10
•Stage II (Logic Gates): 20 MCQs | +10 / -5,Qualify: Top 5
•Stage III (Grand Finale): Pounce & Bounce: +10 (Direct/Pounce) | +5 (Pass) | -5 (Wrong Pounce)

name: CODE MASTER
rules:
•Questions from both C and Java programming languages.
•Two Categories:
           4 Moderate Level, 2. High Level
•Additional 10 marks for participant behaviour.

name: BATTLE GROUND MOBILE INDIA (BGMI) / FREE FIRE
description: BATTLE GROUND MOBILE INDIA (BGMI) / FREE FIRE
rules:
•Players must use their own accounts; account sharing is prohibited.
•Cheating, hacking, or use of unauthorized third-party software will result in immediate disqualification.
•Players must join the custom room within the given time; late entries will not be entertained.
Organizer Rights:
•Organizers reserve the right to modify rules if necessary. Decisions made by referees/judges are final, Any disputes must be raised immediately after the match.

name: VELOCITY VERTICES (Rubik's Cube)
rules:
•The competition will follow the Average of 5 (Ao5) format — each participant must complete five solves.
•Participants are allowed 15 seconds of inspection before each solve. Judges will give warnings at 8 and 12 seconds.
•After stopping the timer, participants must not touch the cube until the judge has verified the result.
•Only a standard 4×4 cube, in clean and proper working condition, is permitted.
•The judge’s decision shall be final.

name: VELOCITY VERTICES (Rubik's Cube)
rules:
•The competition will follow the Average of 5 (Ao5) format — each participant must complete five solves.
•Participants are allowed 15 seconds of inspection before each solve. Judges will give warnings at 8 and 12 seconds.
•After stopping the timer, participants must not touch the cube until the judge has verified the result.
•Only a standard 3×3 in clean and proper working condition, is permitted.
•The judge’s decision shall be final.

name: INTELLECT FUSION
rules:
• Each team must consist of exactly 4 members. 
• The same team must participate throughout all stages. 
• Only one member participates per stage. 
• A participant cannot compete again in later stages. 
• All four members must participate once. 
• No substitution allowed after the event begins 

Stage 1: Matrix Memory Game 
Rules: 
• Matrix will be displayed for 5-15 seconds. 
• No writing, pointing, or discussion during display time. 
• Only the designated Stage 1 player may answer on behalf of the team. 
• Answers once submitted cannot be changed. 
• Use of mobile phones or electronic devices is strictly prohibited. 
• After display time, the matrix is hidden immediately. 
• Time per question: 25-30 seconds 

Stage 2: Spot the Real Logo 
Rules: 
• For each question, four logo options will be displayed. 
• Only the designated Stage 2 player may answer on behalf of the team. 
• Answers once submitted cannot be changed. 
• Use of mobile phones or electronic devices is strictly prohibited. 
• Time per question: 15-20 seconds 

Stage 3: The Pressure Box 
Rules: 
• Only the designated Stage 3 player may touch the materials. 
• Time limit for the round is 3 minutes. 
• The first team to submit the correct final answer will be declared the winner. 

Stage 4: Control the Chaos (Final Round) 
Rules: 
• Only the final unused player may participate in this round. 
• Other team members may guide verbally. 
• Dropping the ball results in a 10-second penalty. 
• Incorrect structure requires a retry.

name: DEBATE CHARADES
rules:
A special highlight of the event is the Two-Bowl System:
•One bowl for selecting the topic
• One bowl for randomly assigning FOR/AGAINST positions
Teams must think on their feet and defend viewpoints assigned at random.
• Topics will be provided prior to the event. Participants should contact the coordinator for the topics and detailed understanding of the rules and regulations.

name: THE ESCAPE ROOM
rules:
Participants will be locked inside a themed room filled with hidden clues, puzzles, and riddles. The objective is simple—but not easy: work as a team, solve all the puzzles, and escape the room within the given time limit.
Every clue matters. Every second counts. Only the sharpest minds will make it out in time!

name: THE HORCRUX HUNT
rules:
•Each team must consist of a maximum of 4 members.
•Participants must strictly follow the instructions given by the event coordinators.
•Any team found cheating or misbehaving will be immediately disqualified.
•The decision of the judges and organizers will be final and binding.

name: ROBO TUG OF WAR
rules:
Build a manually controlled robot to pull the opponent robot across a central line using a rope or hook. The event tests robot power, traction, and structural strength under tension.
Guidelines:
●No prefabricated LEGO parts, no grasping mechanisms, Pré-assembled gear assemblies allowed
●Electrical power only, Allowed batteries: Gel, Lithium, NiCad, Dry cell, Voltage ≤ 16.8V
●Only 1 operator (no controller change)
●Wires must remain slack (no pulling to assist)
●Early start → 1 restart, second = disqualification
●Maximum 3 manual resets (time penalty)
●Arena damage → disqualification
●Misconduct → disqualification

name: NITRO RACE
rules:
●Size ≤ 25 × 25 × 20 cm (±5%), Weight ≤ 3 kg (±2%), Only 1 operator
●Wired (≥2 m wire) or Wireless (Bluetooth/Wi-Fi/Dual frequency), Onboard power required for wireless
●No LEGO parts or grasping mechanisms, Pré-assembled gear assemblies allowed
●Electrical power only, Allowed batteries: Gel, Lithium, NiCad, Dry cell,Voltage ≤ 16.8V DC,
●Misconduct leads to disqualification
●No second attempt for poor performance

name: ROBO SOCCER
rules:
Design and fabricate a manually controlled robot to play a soccer match in an arena. Robot must push and guide the ball using movement and strategy only — no grabbing, holding, or lifting allowed.

Robot Specifications

●Size ≤ 30 × 30 × 20 cm (including wheels), Weight ≤ 5 kg (±2.5%)
●Wired (≥4 m wire) or Wireless (Bluetooth/Wi-Fi/dual frequency)
●Onboard power mandatory, Electrical power only, Allowed batteries: Gel, Lithium, NiCad, Dry cell, Voltage ≤ 25.2V DC
●Referee decision final

name: LAFZ & LAYER” (Kavita sangrah –दिखावा बनाम हकीकत (Appearance vs Reality)
description: LAFZ & LAYER” (Kavita sangrah –दिखावा बनाम हकीकत (Appearance vs Reality)
rules:
●Judges’ decisions will be final and binding.
●Organizers reserve the right to disqualify participants for misconduct.
● Only one team per college is allowed.
●3 minutes per participant.

name: Declamation – Rise of Virtual Influencers
rules:
●Usually 3–5 minutes (strictly follow the given time).
●Exceeding time may lead to negative marking or disqualification.
●Speech must be memorized.
●No paper, mobile, cue cards, or notes allowed on stage.

name: NARI -TALKS” – (“Financial Independence for Women: A New Direction”)
description: NARI -TALKS” – (“Financial Independence for Women: A New Direction”)
rules:
●Participants may speak in English or Hindi.
●No political propaganda, hate speech, or religiously offensive content.
●Avoid personal attacks or sensitive disclosures.
●Content should be respectful, inspiring, and informative.

name: PANEL SAMVAD
rules:
●Total duration of the panel discussion: 40–60 minutes.
●Opening by Moderator: 5 minutes
●Panelists’ discussion: 25–35 minutes
●Audience Q&A: 10–15 minutes

name: Style Spectrum (Fashion Show)
rules:
●This is a team event with approximately 16 participants per team.
●Teams may present their own original theme.
●Participants must bring their own costumes, props, and music track.
●Costumes and performances must be decent and appropriate.
●Props must be safe and should not damage the stage or venue.
●Any vulgar or offensive content will lead to disqualification.
●Participants must follow instructions given by the organizers.

name: Dance Dazzle (Duet Dance)
rules:
●Each team shall consist of two participants.
●The time limit for performance shall be 3–5 minutes.
●Any dance form is permitted, including fusion styles.
●If fusion is performed, the routine must include both western and classical dance styles.
●Emphasis shall be placed on synchronization, coordination, and concept clarity.
●Music tracks must be submitted prior to the event.

name: Solo Dance Competition
rules:
●This is an individual participation event.
●The time limit for each performance shall be 3 minutes.
●Any dance form is permitted, including classical, semi-classical, folk, western, or contemporary styles.
●Music tracks must be submitted to the organizing team prior to the performance in the prescribed format.
●Props are allowed but must be informed and approved by the organizers in advance.

name: Twin Tunes (Duet Singing)
rules:
●This event shall consist of two participants per team.
●The time limit for performance shall be 3–5 minutes.
●Participants may bring their own musical instruments if required.
●Proper coordination between singers is mandatory.
●Backing tracks must be submitted prior to the event.

name: Melody in Sync  (Solo Singing)
rules:
●This is an individual participation event. The time limit for performance shall be 3 minutes.
●Participants may perform any genre (classical, semi-classical, folk, or contemporary).
●Karaoke/backing tracks must be submitted to the organizing team prior to the performance. Participants have to bring their own instruments.
●Lyrics must be appropriate and non-offensive.
●No Bhojpuri Songs

name: Hasna Mana Hai (Stand-Up Comedy)
rules:
1. This is an individual event.
2. Use of abusive, racist, sexist, or vulgar language is strictly prohibited.
3. Political or religiously sensitive content is not allowed.
4. The time limit for performance shall be 5 minutes.

name: Curl & Create (Quilling Art)
rules:
●This is an individual participation event.
●Artwork must be created using quilling (paper filigree) technique only.
●The theme will be announced on the spot. Base sheet/cardboard will be provided by the organizers.
●Participants may bring their own quilling paper strips, tools, and glue. Use of pre-made or pre-prepared quilling elements is strictly prohibited. The time limit for the event shall be 90 minutes.
●Use of mobile phones, reference materials, or external assistance is not allowed.

name: Kala Darpan (Theme-Based Sketching)
rules:
●This is an individual event.
●A3 size sheets will be provided. The theme will be announced 30 minutes prior to the event.
●Basic pencils will be provided.
●The event venue shall be the Graphic Lab.
●The time limit for the event shall be 90 minutes.

name: Henna Hallows (Mandala Art with Henna)
rules:
●This is an individual event.
●Participants will be provided with A4 size sheets. Two henna cones will be provided per participant.
●No additional materials are permitted. The time limit for the event shall be 60 minutes.

name: Moment in Motion (Time-Lapse Video)
rules:
●Two-member team event
●Raw footage must be recorded for approximately 3 hours. Final video duration: 15–30 seconds
●Theme announced on the spot and must be followed. Participants must use their own recording devices
●Editing allowed only within the given time using basic tools. No pre-recorded or external footage allowed
●Video must be submitted in the prescribed format. Content must be original and appropriate

name: Comic Designing Competition: (Comicmania)
rules:
An individual event where participants create a theme-based comic strip using artwork and dialogues to tell a creative story.
●Individual participation only. A3 sheets will be provided
●Theme announced 30 minutes before the event. Bring your own drawing materials
●Minimum 4 panels with dialogues/captions
●No mobile phones or reference materials. Content must be appropriate.
●Time limit: 90 minutes

name: Rangmanch / Automania
rules:
•Max. 8 to 10 member in a team.
•The theme should be based on Indian Knowledge System (IKS)
•Any entry not related to the theme may be disqualified.
•Time Limit 10 to 15 Minutes.
•Participant must bring their own props.

name: Creative Reels
rules:
• Originality: All entries must be original work; plagiarism or copied photos are strictly prohibited.
• Theme Compliance: Reels must follow the given contest theme (e.g., Campus Life, Nature, IKS).
• Content Guidelines: Reels must be appropriate, decent, and should not harm or deface college property.
•The duration of the reels should be 30-40 seconds, including titles and credits.

name: No Fire, All Flavors- (Cooking Without Fire)
description: No Fire, All Flavors- (Cooking Without Fire)
rules:
•Time Limit: 30-45 minutes
•No fire or live coals are allowed to be used
•The dish should be innovative, hygienic, and aesthetically presented.
•All ingredients should be a raw, no pre-cooked items are allowed
•Use of artificial colors, alcohol, or tobacco products is strictly prohibited

name: Ashoka Shark Tank
rules:
•Participants may compete individually or in teams of 2-4 Members.
•Time Limit: 10-15 Min. per team.
•Each team will be given 5-7 minutes for pitching their idea and 3-5 minutes for Q&A with the Sharks.
•The pitch should cover problem identification, proposed solution, target market, revenue model, uniqueness/competitive advantage, estimated cost & funding requirement.
•Presentation may include PPT (compulsory), charts, models, or prototypes (if available).

name: Advert [Advertisement making competition the topics for the AD Max will be given on the spot.
description: Advert [Advertisement making competition the topics for the AD Max will be given on the spot.
rules:
•Each team will have 15 min for preparation.
•Max time limit for performing the Ad is 5 min.
•The criteria for assessment include content, spontaneity and adherence to the topic, coordination, appeal of the topic, advertisement, humour, and performance on the stage.
•Participants may use simple props; Props should be arranged by the teams themselves.
•Advertisement topics will be selected through a chit system and allotted on the spot to each team.

name: HEALTH CAMP
rules:
•The health camp is open to students, staff, and invited participants.
•All participants must register before availing services.
•Health check-ups will be provided as per schedule and availability.
•Discipline and hygiene must be maintained at all times.
•Any medical advice or reports are for guidance only.
•The organizers’ decisions will be final and binding.

name: BEST OUT OF WASTE
rules:
•Participation may be individual or in teams (up to 3 members).
•The product must be created using waste or recyclable materials only.
•The item must be prepared within the allotted time.
•The judges’ decision will be final..
teamSize: Individual or in teams (up to 3 members)

name: PHARMACY RANGOLI
rules:
•The theme must be pharmacy/healthcare related.
•Participation may be individual or in teams (maximum 2–3 members).
•Only dry and eco-friendly materials are allowed.
•Use of ready-made stencils or printed designs is not permitted.
•The judges’ decision will be final and binding.
teamSize: Individual or in teams (up to 3 members)

name: Pharma Expo
rules:
•Participation may be individual or in teams (up to 3 members).
•Participants must bring and manage their own models/posters/materials.
•Use of hazardous or unsafe materials is strictly prohibited.
•The judges’ decision will be final.
teamSize: Individual or in teams (up to 3 members)

name: First Aid Competition
rules:
•Each team may consist of 2–3 members.
•Use of mobile phones or electronic gadgets is strictly prohibited during the event.
•Participants must use only the first aid materials provided at the venue.
•The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

name: HERBAL SHOTS (FLAVONOID AND CAROTENOIDS SHOTS)
rules:
•Participation may be individual or in teams (maximum 2 members per team).
•Participants must prepare herbal shots rich in flavonoids and/or carotenoids.
•Only natural, herbal ingredients are permitted; synthetic additives are not allowed.
•The formulation must be safe for consumption and prepared under hygienic conditions.
•Judging criteria include originality, nutritional value, taste, and presentation.
•The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
teamSize: Individual or in teams (maximum 2 members per team).

name: FORMULATION DEVELOPMENT
rules:
•Participation may be individual or in teams (maximum 2–3 members per team).
•The formulation must be based on the given theme or problem statement.
•Participants must follow standard pharmaceutical procedures and safety norms.
•Only permitted ingredients and materials should be used.
•The formulation should be completed within the allotted time.
•The decision of the judges will be final.
teamSize: Individual or in teams (maximum 2–3 members per team).

name: POSTER PRESENTATION
rules:
•Individual or team participation (maximum 2 members) is allowed.
•Poster size and format should follow organizers’ guidelines.
•Content must be original and free from plagiarism.
•Use of offensive or inappropriate content is not allowed.
•The judges’ decision will be final.

name: QUIZ
rules:
•Each team shall consist of 2–3 participants.
•The quiz will include multiple rounds based on pharmacy subjects.
•Use of mobile phones or electronic gadgets is strictly prohibited.
•The decision of the quiz master/judges will be final.

name: AD MAD SHOW
rules:
•Each team must have 3–6 participants.
•Time limit: 2–3 minutes per performance.
•Content must be original; copied ads,Vulgar, offensive, or inappropriate content is strictly prohibited.
•Use of safe props only; dangerous items are not permitted.
•Pre-recorded audio/video is not allowed.
•Judges’ decision will be final.

name: Ashoka’s Social Cause-“Mission Samarthya” Humari Soch - (Managing a Better Tomorrow)
description: Ashoka’s Social Cause-“Mission Samarthya” Humari Soch - (Managing a Better Tomorrow)
rules:
1.The initiative focuses on affordable digital education, youth innovation, sustainable and ethical growth, and nation-building through responsible use of technology.
2.The Management Department supports this mission through Finance, Marketing, HR, and Entrepreneurship.
3.Finance manages funding and budgeting, Marketing promotes social awareness, HR develops volunteers and leadership, and Entrepreneurship creates sustainable business models.
4.Through these efforts, students work together to create positive social impact and become responsible future leaders.

name: MANAGEMENT EDU- TALK (Sustainable Development Vikshit Bharat -2047)
description: MANAGEMENT EDU- TALK (Sustainable Development Vikshit Bharat -2047)
rules:
1. Stuck to the above-mentioned topic.
2. Establishing ground rules or guidelines
3. Avoid blame, speculation, and inflammatory language.
4. Use 321 rule of Speaking
5. Bilingual language is allowed strictly (ENGLISH & HINDI)

name: MODEX / POSTER GALLERY
rules:
1. BUSINESS MODEL based on current business trends followed by entrepreneurs.
2. There should be significance in relation to Management concepts, thoughts, quotes by famous management Guru’s
3. It can be also related to business tycoons and innovative and successful business entrepreneurs, the role model Industrialist.

name: Fusion Fiesta (RECORDED VIDEO FORMAT)
rules:
1. Students may participate individually or in teams of 2–5 members.
2. Videos should be 60–120 seconds long in MP4 format with at least 720p resolution and clear audio.
3. Content may be in English, Hindi, or bilingual and must not include abusive, political, or religious material.
4. Entries will be judged on creativity, clarity, storytelling, technical quality, and overall impact. Late, plagiarized, or inappropriate submissions will be disqualified.
5. Judges’ decision will be final.
teamSize: Individually or  teams of 2 to 5 members

name: GD MODEL PRESENTATION (Smart City Symposium with SEZ in India)
description: GD MODEL PRESENTATION (Smart City Symposium with SEZ in India)
rules:
1. Refrain from demeaning, discriminatory or harassing behavior, materials, and speech.
2. Refrain from wearing clothing that is not suitable for a professional work environment, that is provocative, or otherwise potentially offensive.
3. Intimidating, harassing, abusive, discriminatory, derogatory, or demeaning materials or conduct by any attendees of the event and related event activities.
4. Physical, written, verbal or other abuse, intimidation, threats, annoyance, harassment, stalking, pushing, shoving or use of any physical force whatsoever against any person.

name: Innovative Gambit-Pitch the Future
rules:
1.Participants may participate individually or in teams. Each team may consist of 2 to 4 members.
2.The business idea must be original, innovative, and viable. Any form of copied content will result in immediate disqualification.
3.Prior registration is mandatory through the mode specified by the organizers. Teams must report to the venue 30 minutes before the scheduled time.
4.Misconduct or unfair practices will lead to disqualification.
5.Certificates and prizes will be awarded to winners and runners-up.

name: Robotics Presentation
rules:
1. It may an individual participant or team-based event.
2. The participant will have to present a working Robot.
3. Selection of participants is based on explanation of Robot with their applications.
Prizes: 1st prize = Rs.150/- & 2nd prize = Rs.100/-

name: Just Imagine
rules:
1. Each participant will bring their stationary items (drawing tools).
2. Coordinator will provide Drawing sheet to participants.
3. The best three will be the winner based on performance.

Prizes: 1st prize = Rs.150/- & 2nd prize = Rs.100/-

name: Graphica
rules:
1.Task sheets are provided to each participant.
2.They have to draw the same on the system separately.
3.The best three will be the winner based on performance.

Prizes: 1st prize = Rs.150/- & 2nd prize = Rs.100/-

name: Picture Perception Test
rules:
1. Candidates will be shown an image for 3 minutes on screen after them provide them 20 minutes for story writing.
2. In story writing candidate is expected to project himself onto the central character.
3. Story should contain title, number of person and their age and sex in a rectangular box top of the page.
4. Story should be 100-200 words long.
5. Also represent their story individually in front of jury member within 6 minutes.
6. Medium of story writing will be in English.

Prizes: 1st prize = Rs.150/- & 2nd prize = Rs.100/-

name: Model Exhibition
rules:
1. It may an individual participant or team-based event.
2. The participant will have to present a working model.
3. Selection of participants is based on explanation of model with their applications.

Prizes: 
1st prize = Rs.150/- 
2nd prize = Rs.100/-

name: Junk Yard
rules:
1. This may be individual or team-based event.
2. Participant will have to make creative design or working model with the help of given raw materials.
3. Coordinators will provide raw materials and tools.
4. Materials provided are: wood, fevicol, rubber band, iron nails, plywood, etc.

Prizes: 
1st prize = Rs.150/- 
2nd prize = Rs.100/-

name: GUESS THE GADGET -Touch & Feel + Hint (Yantra Anumana)
description: GUESS THE GADGET -Touch & Feel + Hint (Yantra Anumana)
rules:
• Participants may not observe the gadget before touch.
• Only one player touches at a time.
• No shaking, sound guessing, or visual attempts.
• Decisions by the host/judges are final.

name: ElectRONICA – Electronics Project Exhibition (Yantra Pragya Expo)
description: ElectRONICA – Electronics Project Exhibition (Yantra Pragya Expo)

name: BATTLE OF COMPONENT AND SENSORS (Circuit Samar)
description: BATTLE OF COMPONENT AND SENSORS (Circuit Samar)

name: ROBO RACE (Robo Vega)
rules:
TRACK OVERVIEW: The race track is designed as an obstacle course where robots race from the Start Line to the Finish Line within the competition arena. The track includes straight paths, curves, checkpoints, and obstacles placed at various points.
🧱 ARENA DIMENSIONS
• Overall, Arena Size: Approx. 32 ft × 24 ft (rectangular).
• Track Length: 80–100 ft (approx.) measured along the racing path.
• Track Width: • 40 cm at the Start Zone / Bot lanes. • 80–180 cm at wide sections & obstacle areas.

name: Volt Vision – Project Expo
rules: Volt Vision is a project presentation event organized by the Electrical Engineering Department, featuring innovative projects by students from first year to final year. The expo provides a platform to showcase technical skills, creativity, and practical electrical solutions.

name: Watt’s the Answer?
rules:
• The quiz may consist of multiple rounds.
• Questions may be objective or subjective.
• Use of electronic devices is strictly prohibited.
• Tie-breaker rounds may be conducted if required.
• The quizmaster’s decision is final.

name: Antardrishti Chitra – Blind Circuit Art
rules:
• Only verbal instructions are allowed.
•No predefined symbols or templates may be used.
• Drawings will be judged based on accuracy, clarity, and completeness.
• Any form of signalling other than speech is prohibited.
• Judges’ evaluation will be final.

name: Steady Hand Game
rules:
• Touching the sides of the circuit path will result in penalty points.
• Time and accuracy will both be considered for evaluation.
• Any intentional damage to the setup will result in immediate disqualification.
• Judges’ decisions are final.

name: Yantra Memory Grid
rules:
• Symbols must be matched accurately to score points.
•Incorrect matches may result in negative marking.
•No physical marking or external notes are allowed.
•The participant with the highest score wins.

name: Maze Navigation Challenge
rules:
• Racing cars / robotic vehicles required for navigation will be provided by the organizers. Participants are not permitted to bring their hardware.
• Participants must complete the maze within the given time limit.
• Any form of external assistance or unfair practice will lead to immediate disqualification.
• Judges’ decisions shall be final and binding.

name: Paper Tower challenge
rules:
➢Teams must construct a free-standing paper tower using the materials provided.
➢Time limit: 45 minutes
➢Use of glue, tape, thread, cardboard, or any additional materials is strictly prohibited
➢The tower must safely support the weight and remain stable for at least 30 seconds to be considered valid.
➢If more than one tower supports the weight, the tallest stable tower will be declared the Winner.
➢Judges’ decision will be final and last decision.

name: Autocad drawing competition
rules:
➢The drawing problem will be provided on the spot.
➢Time duration: 2 Hours.
➢Drawing must be prepared only using AutoCAD software.
➢Use of the internet, blocks, Pre saved files, templates are strictly prohibited
➢Submission format: .dwg file only, within the allotted time.
➢The judge's decision will be final and last decision.

name: General engineering quiz
rules:
➢The quiz is open to all engineering branches.
➢The quiz will be conducted in multiple rounds (Preliminary, Technical, Rapid Fire).
➢Use of mobile phones, smart watches, books, or any unfair means is strictly prohibited.
➢The decision of the quiz master/judging panel shall be final and binding

name: Ice cream stick load bearing:
rules:
• Only ice-cream sticks + fevicol allowed
•Base size: max 20 cm × 20 cm Height: min 25 cm, max 40 cm Top flat area: 5 cm × 5 cm compulsory
•Time limit: 35 minutes
•More load bearing = winner
•Judge decision is final

name: CRIMSON LAB
rules:
• Duration: 90 min per team
•Capacity: 2 batches (9am-12:30pm & 1pm-4pm)
•Participants: 50-60 students
•Team size: 3-4 members

name: Link It Fast
rules:
•Only one chance per player.
•No team help allowed.
•Time limit: 30–60 seconds.
•Wrong match ends the turn.
•Player with maximum correct matches wins.

name: Mute Message Mayhem
rules:
• (6–7 players)
•Players stand in a straight line.
•The first player is shown an action or word by the organizer.
•Each player watches only the person in front.
•The last player guesses the message.
•✅ Only actions allowed
•Correct final answer wins the game.

name: Float & Focus
rules:
• Single Player Game
•Balloon should not fall down.
• Cups must not be touched or displaced.
•If the balloon falls or cups move, the game ends.
•Maximum time or successful movement decides the winner.

name: Step Smart Challenge
rules:
• Group of 4 players 
• Only three steps at a time are allowed.                                                                          
• Cups must not touch or cross each other.
